message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(s.getOutputStream());
dos.write(b, 0, b.length);
dos.flush();
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of using PrintStream, you should use DataOutputStream to send the byte array. The write method of DataOutputStream allows you to write byte array directly to the output stream. This will ensure that the byte array is sent as it is without any conversion. On the server side, you should use DataInputStream to read the byte array.
